newsitem.title: USA: Universal Forest sees 1996 exceeding goals.
newsitem.headline: Universal Forest sees 1996 exceeding goals.

text.p: Universal Forest Products Inc, a producer of wood products for the do-it-yourself retail and manufactured housing markets, said on Tuesday it expects to exceed internal sales and earnings goals for the 1996 year.

"Based on our expectations that fourth quarter performance will be consistent with our plan, we anticipate exceeding our internal goals for net sales and earnings for the year," Chief Executive William Currie said in a statement.
"We are very pleased with our earnings and sales to date, and even though the fourth quarter is historically our slowest, we believe this will be an excellent year for Universal," Currie said.
Universal had set 1996 goals of growing earnings and sales by 12-15 percent. For 1995, the company earned $14 million on sales of about $739 million.
Universal today reported record third quarter earnings.

In September Universal acquired Hi-Tek Forest Products Inc, a manufacturer of roof and floor trusses for factory manufactured homes. Currie said management expects the acquisition will make an immediate contribution to sales and profits.
